prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories:
A five-month-old baby experienced cardiac arrest at a theme park on Thursday, leading to the arrest of a 27-year-old woman from Essex on suspicion of neglecting the child, causing unnecessary harm.

The infant remains in critical condition at the hospital after the incident, which occurred at Legoland Windsor around 13:00 BST on Thursday, according to the police.

The detained woman has been released on bail until July 26.

Detective Constable Zoe Eele of the Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit expressed her sympathy for the baby's family and urged anyone with information, particularly those who were in line for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between 11:30am and 12:45pm, to come forward.

The police have requested that the public refrain from speculating about the incident and respect the family's privacy during this difficult time.

The authorities have stated that they are not seeking additional suspects in connection with the incident.

Legoland Windsor released a statement confirming that a young visitor fell ill on Thursday, and their trained First Aid team provided immediate care until the emergency services arrived. The theme park will continue to cooperate with the ongoing police investigation.

A five-month-old infant suffered a cardiac arrest at Legoland Windsor on Thursday, resulting in the arrest of a 27-year-old Essex woman on suspicion of child neglect and causing harm to the child. 

The baby remains in critical condition in hospital following the incident, which occurred around 13:00 BST on Thursday, police confirmed. 

The woman arrested has been released on bail pending further investigation until July 26. 

Detective Constable Zoe Eele of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit extended her sympathies to the baby's family and appealed to anyone with information, especially those in the queue for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between 11:30am and 12:45pm, to come forward. 

Police have asked the public to refrain from speculating about the incident and respect the family's privacy during this difficult time. 

Authorities have stated that they are not currently looking for any additional suspects in connection with the incident. 

Legoland Windsor confirmed that a young visitor fell ill on Thursday and their trained First Aid team provided immediate care until the emergency services arrived, and the theme park will continue to cooperate with the ongoing police investigation.

The infant remains in a critical state in hospital after the incident, which occurred at around 13:00 BST on Thursday, according to police. 

The arrested woman has been released on bail until July 26, pending further investigation. 

Detective Constable Zoe Eele of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit expressed sympathy to the baby's family and urged anyone with information, particularly those in the queue for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between 11:30am and 12:45pm, to come forward. 

The police have asked the public to refrain from speculating about the incident and respect the family's privacy during this difficult time. 

Currently, no other suspects are being sought in connection with the incident, authorities stated. 

Legoland Windsor confirmed that a young visitor became unwell on Thursday and their trained First Aid team provided immediate care until the emergency services arrived, and the theme park will continue to cooperate with the ongoing police investigation.
